|signature_alt = |footnotes = }} 'Marcelo Osvaldo Magnasco' is a biophysicist
and currently a professor at the Rockefeller University.

He is known for his work on thermal ratchets as models of biological
motors, {{citation |title=Making Models of Muscle Contraction |first1=John
|last1=Maddox |journal=Nature (News and Views) |date=Sep 16, 1993 |volume=365
|pages=203 }} auditory biophysics, {{citation |title=Canaries Change
Their Tune |journal=Nature News |first1=Phillip |date=Nov 2, 2001 |last1=Ball
|doi=10.1038/news011108-2 }} {{citation |title=What's shaking in the
ear? |last1=Cho |first1=Adrian |journal=Science |volume=288 |pages=1954â1955
|date=Jun 16, 2000 }} neural coding,; {{citation |title=Complexity
Digest 2000.19 |url=http://comdig.unam.mx/index.php?id_issue=2000.19
|publisher=Complexity Digest |date=Feb 19, 2001 }} other studies of
biological networks such as leaf venation.; {{citation
|url=http://www.sciencefriday.com/videos/watch/10277 |title=Lighting Up Leaves
|first1=Flora |last1=Lichtman |publisher=Science Friday |date=Feb 19, 2010
}} and for placing the date of the solar eclipse mentioned in the Odyssey
at April 16th, 1178 B.C. {{citation
|url=http://www.pnas.org/cgi/content/abstract/0803317105v1 |title=Is an eclipse
described in the Odyssey? |first1=Constantino |last1= Baikouzis |first2=Marcelo
O. |last2= Magnasco |publisher=Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
|date=June 24, 2008 |doi=10.1073/pnas.0803317105 |accessdate=2008-06-27
|journal=Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences |volume=105 |pages=8823
|pmid=18577587 |pmc=2440358 }} together with Constantino Baikouzis of the
National University of La Plata. {{citation
